text: また君に借りができたな / 返すつもりもないんでしょう
translation: I'm in your debt again. / You probably don't intend to repay it, do you?
grammar: ができた - potential form indicating 'a debt was created'. んでしょう - polite presumption/assumption pattern

text: 彼らが情報公開法を縦に迫っていた資料ですが / ダミーも混ぜてあしらっておきました
translation: Regarding the documents they were demanding using the Freedom of Information Act as leverage / I mixed in some dummies and dealt with it.

vocabulary.reading: じょうほうこうかいほう

vocabulary.meaning: using as leverage, making use of

grammar: を縦に - idiomatic expression meaning 'using X as leverage'. ておく - te-form + おく indicates preparation/advance action

text: 政府は裏で法的整備を進めていますが / 近日中に頓挫の予定です / どうです? / 例の計画の方もこっちで手を打ちましょうか
translation: The government is proceeding with legal preparations behind the scenes, but / it's scheduled to fall through soon. / How about it? / Shall we take care of that plan on our end as well?

vocabulary.meaning: to take measures, to take action

grammar: ていますが - continuing action with が as soft contrast. 予定です - 'it is scheduled/planned'. ましょうか - polite suggestion/offer

text: いや君の資料を見る限り問題はながろう / ではシナリオ通りに
translation: No, as far as I can see from your documents, there shouldn't be any problems. / Then, as per the scenario.

vocabulary.meaning: as far as one can see, judging from

grammar: 見る限り - 'as far as seeing goes'. なかろう - classical negative presumption form of ない

text: コーヒーじゃないんですか? / 日本人はね、昔から朝はご飯と味噌汁、そしてお酒って相場が決まってんのよ。 / み / さとさんがでしょ。 / 何よ。
translation: Isn't it coffee? / For Japanese people, you see, it's been decided since long ago that breakfast is rice and miso soup, and sake. / That's / just you, Misato-san, isn't it? / What?

vocabulary.meaning: to be decided, to be established

grammar: 決まってんのよ - casual contraction of 決まっているのよ. がでしょ - particle が + でしょう indicates 'isn't it (you)?'

text: だいたい今朝の食事当番は誰でしたっけ?
translation: Anyway, who was on breakfast duty this morning again?
grammar: でしたっけ - past tense + っけ particle for confirming memory/recalling information

text: みさとさんがその年で未だに一人なの。分かったような気がします。 / 悪かったわね、ガサツで。 / ズボラもでしょ。 / うっ、そうわね。 / ごちそうさま
translation: Misato-san, at your age, still being single. I think I understand. / Sorry for being crude. / And sloppy too, right? / Ugh, yes. / Thanks for the meal.

vocabulary.meaning: thank you for the meal (after eating)

grammar: ような気がする - 'have a feeling that'. わね - feminine particle. もでしょ - も (also) + でしょう (right?)

text: 本当に今日は学校へ来るんですか? / 当たり前でしょ?進路相談なんだから / でも仕事で忙しいのに / いいのいいのこれも仕事だからね / 仕事ですか
translation: Are you really coming to school today? / Of course, right? It's a career counseling meeting. / But you're busy with work... / It's fine, it's fine, this is also work. / It's work?

vocabulary.meaning: because it is, since it is

grammar: 来るんですか - explanatory の + です. なんだから - explanatory な + んだから (because). のに - despite, although

text: はい
translation: Yes.
grammar: Simple affirmative response

text: あらわざわざありがとう / え?少し待っててね / みさとさんそんな格好で出て行かないでよ / 恥ずかしいから。 / はいはい。
translation: Oh my, thank you for going out of your way. / Huh? Wait a moment. / Misato-san, don't go out in that outfit! / It's embarrassing. / Yes, yes.

vocabulary.meaning: expressly, specially, going out of one's way

grammar: 待っててね - te-form + いる contracted to てて + ね. ないでよ - negative request with よ for emphasis

text: おはよう、イカナリくん。 / では、ミサノさん、行ってきます! / 行ってらっしゃい。
translation: Good morning, Ikari-kun. / Well then, Misato-san, I'm off! / Have a good day.

vocabulary.meaning: have a good day, go and come back

grammar: Standard greeting exchanges for leaving and staying at home

text: 早 / く行こうよ。
translation: Let's / go quickly.
grammar: 行こうよ - volitional form + よ for casual suggestion/invitation

text: 皮肉か。 / ま、砕けて表情が増えてきたのは、いい傾向かな。
translation: Sarcasm, huh? / Well, the fact that he's loosened up and showing more expressions is a good trend, I suppose.
grammar: 増えてきた - てくる indicates gradual change. のは - nominalizer. かな - particle expressing uncertainty/wonder

text: 誰あれ? / 怒りの保護者? / なに / 怒りってあんな美しいに保護されてんの? / バ / カみたい
translation: Who's that? / Ikari's guardian? / What? / Ikari is being looked after by someone that beautiful? / Sounds / stupid.
grammar: されてんの - casual contraction of されているの. みたい - like, seems like

text: やっぱ、ミサトさんってええわ
translation: As I thought, Misato-san is great!
grammar: やっぱ - casual contraction of やっぱり. って - quotative/topic particle. ええわ - Kansai dialect for いいわ

text: そっか、あれでメルフの作戦プチュウエーいうのがまたすごい / そうかな
translation: I see, and on top of that she's NERV's Operations Director, which is amazing. / You think so?
grammar: そっか - casual contraction of そうか. というのが - 'the fact that'. また - 'moreover, on top of that'

text: ええかったな、ケンスケ / シンジが / おとさまで / ま、敵じゃないのは確 / かに / ね
translation: That's good, Kensuke. / Since it's Shinji / and all. / Well, she's definitely / not / an enemy.
grammar: ええかった - Kansai dialect for よかった. で - particle indicating reason/context. じゃない - negative form

text: 当時たちはあの人のだらしなさを知らないんだ / ああいう人が彼女やったらな / 苦労すると思うよ / わか / ってないね、先生 / よっしゃ!
translation: Those guys don't know how sloppy that person is. / If someone like that were your girlfriend... / I think you'd have a hard time. / You don't / understand, Sensei! / Alright!

vocabulary.meaning: to have a hard time, to struggle

grammar: 知らないんだ - explanatory の + だ. やったら - たら conditional. わかってない - contracted negative て-form

text: 地球の平和は / お前に任せた! / だから、ミサトさんは私らに任 / せろ!
translation: Earth's peace / I entrust to you! / So, leave Misato-san / to us!
grammar: 任せた - past tense used for emphasis/commitment. 任せろ - imperative form of 任せる

text: 初号機、冷却地をクリア / 作業はセカンドステージ / に行く / 平和か…そのためのエヴァ… / エヴァって何なんだろう?
translation: Unit-01 has cleared the cooling level. / Work will proceed / to the second stage. / Peace, huh... Eva for that purpose... / What is Eva, really?
grammar: って - quotative particle. なんだろう - what is it? (wondering/questioning)

text: 血の匂いがするエントリープラグ… / どうして落ち着くんだろう
translation: The entry plug that smells of blood... / I wonder why it's calming.

vocabulary.meaning: to calm down, to feel at ease

grammar: がする - to emit, to have (smell/sound). どうして - why. んだろう - wondering/questioning with explanatory の

text: 結局、僕は何も分かってないんだ
translation: In the end, I don't understand anything.
grammar: 何も + negative = 'nothing at all'. ないんだ - explanatory の + だ for realization/emphasis

text: 0号機の胸部生体部品はどう? / 大破ですからね
translation: How's Unit-00's chest biological components? / They're severely damaged.
grammar: はどう - how is/are. ですからね - から indicates reason/cause, ね for confirmation

text: 新作しますが、追加予算の枠ギリギリですよ / これでドイツから2号機が届けば、少しは楽になるのかしら / 逆かもしれませんよ / 地上でやってる使徒の処理も、タダじゃないんでしょ?
translation: We'll manufacture new ones, but it's right at the limit of the additional budget. / If Unit-02 arrives from Germany with this, I wonder if things will get a bit easier. / It might be the opposite. / The Angel disposal being done above ground isn't free either, right?
grammar: 届けば - conditional form. 楽になる - to become easier. のかしら - feminine wondering. タダじゃない - not free

text: ほんと、お金に関してはせこいところね / 人類の命運をかけてるんでしょ、 / ここ / 人はエヴァのびで生きるにあらず、生き残った人たちが生きていくにはお金がかかるのよ。
translation: Really, you're stingy when it comes to money. / The fate of humanity is at stake here, / isn't it? / Man does not live by Eva alone. It takes money for the people who survive to go on living.
grammar: に関しては - regarding, when it comes to. をかけてる - staking/risking. にあらず - classical negative, 'not by X alone' (biblical reference)

text: 予算ね。じゃあ指令はまた会議なの? / ええ。今は机上の人よ。
translation: Budget, huh? So the Commander is in meetings again? / Yes. Right now he's a desk person.
grammar: ね - confirmation particle. また - again. なの - explanatory の. 机上の人 - 'desk person' (doing paperwork)

text: 指令が留守だとここも静かでいいですね。
translation: When the Commander is away, it's nice and quiet here.
grammar: だと - when/if. でいい - is good/nice. ですね - polite confirmation

text: 失礼。便乗ついでにここよろしいですか。
translation: Excuse me. While I'm at it, may I take care of this here?
grammar: 便乗ついでに - 'while taking advantage of the opportunity'. よろしいですか - polite request for permission

text: サンプル回収の修正予算、 / あっさり通りましたね。
translation: The revised budget for sample recovery / passed easily, didn't it?
grammar: 通りました - past tense of 通る (to pass). ね - seeking confirmation/agreement

text: 委員会も自分が生き残ることを最優先に考えている。そのための彼は惜しむまい。 / 人はもう現れないというのが彼らの論拠でしたからね。 / ああ、もう一つ朗報です。
translation: The committee also considers their own survival as the top priority. They won't hesitate to spend money for that purpose. / Their argument was that the Angels wouldn't appear anymore. / Ah, there's one more piece of good news.

vocabulary.meaning: to be reluctant to, to hesitate to spend

grammar: そのための彼は惜しむまい - まい indicates negative presumption/will not

text: 米国を除くすべての理事国がエヴァ6号機の予算を承認しました。
translation: All council nations except the United States have approved the budget for Eva Unit 06.
grammar: を除く - except for, excluding

text: まあ、米国も時間の問題でしょう。 / 失業者アレルギーですしね、あの国。 / 君の国は? / 8号機から建造に参加します。
translation: Well, it's just a matter of time for the US too. / That country is allergic to unemployment, after all. / What about your country? / We'll participate in construction starting with Unit 08.
grammar: ですしね - casual confirmation with し adding a reason

text: 第二次整備計画はまだ生きてますから。 / ただパイロットが見つかっていないという問題はありますが。 / 使徒は再び現れた。
translation: The Second Supplementary Plan is still alive. / Though there is the problem that we haven't found pilots yet. / The Angels have appeared again.

vocabulary.meaning: to be alive, to be in effect

grammar: 見つかっていない - negative continuation of state using ている

text: 我々の道は彼らを倒すしかあるまい。 / 私もセカンドインパクトの二の舞はごめんですからね。
translation: Our path is nothing but to defeat them. / I don't want a repeat of Second Impact either.
grammar: しかあるまい - nothing but, must (formal negative presumption)

text: じゃあ、南極大陸が蒸 / 発したセカンドインパクトって。
translation: So then, Second Impact when the Antarctic continent evaporated...
grammar: って - casual quotative/topic marker at end of sentence for questioning

text: そう、歴史の教科書では大質量隕石の落下による大惨事となっているけど、事実は往々にして隠蔽されるものなのよ。
translation: Right. In history textbooks it's presented as a catastrophe from a massive meteorite impact, but the truth is often concealed.
grammar: ものなのよ - explanatory のだ form with feminine ending よ

text: 15年前、人類は最初の人と呼称する人型の物体を南極で発見したの。
translation: 15 years ago, humanity discovered a humanoid object in Antarctica that we call the First Angel.
grammar: と呼称する - to call/designate as

text: でもその調査中に原因不明の大爆発を起こしたの。
translation: But during the investigation, it caused a massive explosion of unknown origin.
grammar: を起こす - to cause, to trigger (an incident)

text: それがセカンドインパクトの正体。 / じゃあ、 / 僕らのやってることは。
translation: That's the true nature of Second Impact. / So then... / what we're doing is...
grammar: やっていること - nominalized form of やっている (what we're doing)

text: 予想されうるサードインパクトを未然に防ぐ / そのためのネルフとエヴァンゲリオンなのよ
translation: Preventing the predicted Third Impact before it happens - that's what NERV and Evangelion are for.
grammar: されうる - potential form of される (can be predicted); そのための - for that purpose

text: ところであれ予定通り明日やるそうよ
translation: By the way, I heard they're doing that thing tomorrow as scheduled.
grammar: やるそうよ - hearsay そうだ with feminine よ

text: わかったわ
translation: Understood.
grammar: わ - feminine sentence ending particle

text: おはよう / おはようございます / 仕事で旧東京まで行ってくるわ
translation: Good morning. / Good morning. / I'm going to Old Tokyo for work.
grammar: 行ってくるわ - going and coming back (ていく + くる) with feminine わ

text: 多分帰りは遅いからなんか出張って / じゃ
translation: I'll probably be back late, so get something for dinner. / Well then.
grammar: なんか出張って - casual contraction, likely meaning to get food; って at end implies continuation

text: あ、はい
translation: Oh, okay.
grammar: Simple acknowledgment

text: ここがかつて花の都と呼ばれていた大都会とはね / 着いたわよ
translation: To think this was once a great metropolis called the City of Flowers. / We've arrived.
grammar: とはね - expresses surprise/emotion about the topic; わよ - feminine emphatic

text: 何もこんなところでやらなくてもいいのに / でその計画戦時は絡んでるの / 戦略自衛隊
translation: They didn't have to do it in a place like this. / So is the military involved in this plan? / The Strategic Self-Defense Force.

vocabulary.meaning: to be involved, to be entangled

vocabulary.reading: せんりゃくじえいたい

grammar: なくてもいいのに - didn't have to/need to (with regret/criticism)

text: いえ介入は認められずよ / 通りで好きにやってるわけね
translation: No, their intervention isn't permitted. / No wonder they're doing whatever they want.
grammar: わけね - explanatory わけだ with confirmation ね

text: 本日はご多忙のところ / 我が日本重化学工業協同隊の実演会にお越しいただき / 誠にありがとうございます
translation: Thank you very much for taking time from your busy schedules to attend our Japan Heavy Chemical Industries Consortium demonstration today.

vocabulary.reading: じゅうかがくこうぎょう

grammar: お越しいただき - humble receiving form (thank you for coming)

text: 皆様には後ほど完成室の方にて / 更新運転をご覧いただきますが
translation: Later, everyone will be able to view the activation operation in the completion room.
grammar: ご覧いただく - humble receiving form (we will show you); が at end indicates continuation

text: ご質問のある方はこの場にてどうぞ / はい / これはご高名な赤城律子博士 / お越しいただき光栄の至りです
translation: Those with questions, please ask now. / Yes. / This is the renowned Dr. Ritsuko Akagi. / It's a great honor to have you here.
grammar: の至り - utmost/extreme degree (formal expression)

text: 質問をよろしいでしょうか / ご遠慮なくどうぞ / 先ほどのご説明ですと / 内燃機関を内蔵とありますが
translation: May I ask a question? / Please, don't hesitate. / According to your earlier explanation, / it has an internal combustion engine built-in...
grammar: ですと - according to, if; とありますが - it says/states but...

text: 本機の大きな特徴です / 連続150日間の作戦行動が保障されております
translation: That's a major feature of this unit. / It guarantees continuous operational activity for 150 days.
grammar: されております - polite passive form with おる (formal business language)

text: しかし格闘船を前提とした陸戦兵器にリアクターを内蔵することは
translation: However, installing a reactor in a land combat weapon designed for close combat...
grammar: を前提とした - based on the premise of; することは - doing... (topic)

text: 安全性の点から見てもリスクが大きすぎると思われますが / 5分も動かない決戦兵器よりは役に立つと思いますよ
translation: From a safety perspective, the risk seems too great. / I think it's more useful than a decisive weapon that can't even move for 5 minutes.
grammar: から見ても - even from the perspective of; も動かない - can't even move

text: 遠隔操縦では緊急対処に問題を残します / パイロットに負担をかけ精神汚染を起こすよりはより人道的と考えます
translation: Remote control has problems with emergency response. / We consider it more humane than burdening pilots and causing mental contamination.
grammar: よりは - rather than, compared to; と考えます - we think that

text: よしなさいよ大人げない / 人的制御の問題もあります / 制御不能に陥り暴走を許す危険極まりない兵器よりは安全だと思いますがね
translation: Stop it, that's childish. / There's also the problem of human control. / I think it's safer than an extremely dangerous weapon that can fall into loss of control and allow a rampage.
grammar: よしなさいよ - imperative to stop with feminine よ; 危険極まりない - extremely dangerous

text: 制御できない兵器など全くのナンセンスです / ヒステリーを起こした女性と同じですよ / 手に負えません
translation: A weapon that can't be controlled is complete nonsense. / It's the same as a woman having a fit of hysteria. / It's unmanageable.
grammar: など - such things as (dismissive); 全くの - complete, utter; と同じ - the same as

text: そのためのパイロットとテクノロジーです / まさか科学と人の心があの化け物を抑えるとでも本気ですか / ええもちろんですよ
translation: That's what the pilot and technology are for. / You can't seriously believe that science and the human heart can control that monster? / Yes, of course I do.

vocabulary.meaning: to control, to restrain, to suppress

grammar: とでも - expresses doubt/incredulity about a statement; 本気ですか - rhetorical question expressing disbelief

text: 人の心などという曖昧なものに頼っているから / ネルフは先のような暴走を許すんですよ
translation: Because you rely on something as vague as the human heart, / NERV allows incidents like the previous runaway to happen.

vocabulary.meaning: to rely on, to depend on

grammar: などという - dismissive expression 'such a thing as'; から - reason marker; んですよ - explanatory tone with emphasis

text: その結果国連は莫大な追加予算を迫られ / 某国では2万人を超える合社を出そうとしているんです
translation: As a result, the UN was forced to provide a massive supplementary budget, / and a certain country is about to report over 20,000 casualties.

vocabulary.meaning: to be pressed, to be forced

grammar: 迫られる - passive form indicating being forced; 超える - 'to exceed'; んです - explanatory tone

text: その上あれほど重要な事件に関わらず / 未だにその原因が不明とは
translation: On top of that, despite it being such an important incident, / the cause is still unknown.
grammar: に関わらず - 'despite, regardless of'; とは - expresses surprise or criticism at the end of a sentence

text: せめて責任者としての責務は全うしてほしいもんですな / よかったですね / ネルフが超法規的に保護されていて
translation: At the very least, I'd like you to fulfill your duties as the person responsible. / How nice for you / that NERV is protected by extra-legal measures.

vocabulary.meaning: at least, at the very least

grammar: としての - 'as a ~'; てほしいもんですな - requesting with polite yet critical tone; されていて - te-form connecting clauses

text: あなた方はその責任も取らずに済みますから / なんとおっしゃられようと / ネルフの主力兵器以外 / あの敵生体は倒せません / ATフィールドですか?
translation: Because you can get away without taking responsibility. / No matter what you say, / without NERV's main weapons, / those enemy organisms cannot be defeated. / The AT Field?

vocabulary.meaning: to get away without doing, to avoid having to do

grammar: ずに済む - 'to avoid having to, to get away without'; おっしゃられようと - honorific + volitional + と meaning 'no matter what you say'

text: それも今では時間の問題に過ぎません / いつまでもネルフの時代ではありませんよ
translation: Even that is now just a matter of time. / It won't be NERV's era forever.
grammar: に過ぎない - 'nothing more than, merely'; いつまでも～ではありません - negative form emphasizing impermanence

text: フラッチャン / クソッ / あのゾグブスどもが
translation: Damn it! / Shit! / Those bastards.
grammar: ども - plural suffix that can be neutral or derogatory depending on context; here used derogatorily

text: どうせうちの利権にあぶれた連中の腹いせでしょ / 腹立つわね / こら
translation: They're probably just venting their frustration at missing out on our interests. / It's infuriating. / Hey!

vocabulary.meaning: to miss out, to be left out

grammar: にあぶれた - 'missed out on'; でしょ - casual form of でしょう expressing assumption

text: およしなさいよほとなげない
translation: Stop it, be mature about it.
grammar: およしなさい - polite command form 'please stop'; 大人げない - na-adjective meaning 'immature, childish'

text: お疲れ様でした
translation: Good work, thank you for your efforts.

vocabulary.meaning: thank you for your hard work

grammar: お疲れ様でした - standard polite phrase expressing appreciation for effort/work completed

text: バランス正常 動力異常なし 了解
translation: Balance normal. Power normal. Acknowledged.
grammar: Technical status reporting language; なし - 'without, none'

text: 引き続き左足前へ / 両方揃う
translation: Continue with left foot forward. / Both aligned.

vocabulary.meaning: to be aligned, to be complete

grammar: へ - direction marker; 揃う - intransitive verb meaning 'to be aligned'

text: へえ ちゃんと歩いてる 自慢するだけのことはあるよね
translation: Wow, it's actually walking. I guess they have reason to be proud of it.
grammar: だけのことはある - 'to be worth it, to have reason to'; よね - seeking confirmation/agreement

text: どうした / 変です リアクターの内圧が上昇していきます / 一時冷却水の温度も上昇し
translation: What's wrong? / Something's strange. The reactor's internal pressure is rising. / The primary coolant temperature is also rising.

vocabulary.reading: いちじれいきゃくすい

grammar: していきます - progressive action continuing into the future; も - 'also, too'

text: バルブ開放 原則材を注入 / ダメです!本部の出力が上がりません!
translation: Open the valve! Inject control material! / It's no good! The main output isn't rising!
grammar: を注入 - object marker with action verb; 上がりません - negative polite form indicating failure

text: いかん!動力閉鎖、緊急停止 / 停止信号、発信を確認
translation: This is bad! Shut down power, emergency stop! / Stop signal transmission confirmed.
grammar: いかん - masculine/formal exclamation; を確認 - confirming/verifying something

text: 受信されず、無散回路も普通です! / 制御不能! / そんな馬鹿な… / うわああああ / ああああああああああああああああああああああああ
translation: Not receiving! The backup circuit is normal too! / Out of control! / That's impossible... / Ahhhhhh / Ahhhhhhhhhh!
grammar: されず - negative form of passive; そんな馬鹿な - expressing disbelief 'that's absurd/impossible'

text: 作った人に似て礼儀知らずなロボットね
translation: Just like its creator, an ill-mannered robot.

vocabulary.meaning: to resemble, to be similar to

grammar: に似て - 'resembling, like'; 知らず - suffix meaning 'lacking, without knowledge of'

text: からつきに異常発生!制御を作動しません!
translation: Abnormality in the mechanical unit! Controls are not responding!
grammar: を作動しません - negative form indicating 'not operating/functioning'

text: このままでは路線誘拐の危険もあります / 信じられん
translation: At this rate, there's also danger of core meltdown. / Unbelievable.
grammar: では - conditional marker; もあります - 'there is also'; られん - contracted negative potential form

text: JAにはあらゆるミスを想定し、すべてに対処すべくプログラムは組まれているのに、この世の事態はありえないはずだ。 / だけど今、現に炉心誘拐の危機が迫っているのよ。
translation: JA is programmed to anticipate every mistake and deal with everything, so this situation shouldn't be possible. / But right now, the danger of core meltdown is actually approaching.
grammar: すべく - 'in order to'; はずだ - expressing expectation; 現に - 'actually, in reality'; のに - 'although, despite'

text: こうなっては自然に停止するのを待つしか方法は…。 / 自動停止の確率は? / 0.00002%。まさに奇跡です。
translation: At this point, our only option is to wait for it to stop naturally... / What's the probability of automatic shutdown? / 0.00002%. It would truly be a miracle.

vocabulary.meaning: at this point, now that it's come to this

grammar: こうなっては - 'now that it's come to this'; しか～ない - 'only, nothing but'; まさに - emphasis adverb

text: 奇跡を待つより捨て身の努力よ。停止手段を教えなさい。 / 方法はすべて試した。
translation: Better a desperate effort than waiting for a miracle. Tell me how to stop it. / We've tried every method.
grammar: より - comparative 'rather than'; 教えなさい - command form 'tell me'; すべて - 'all, everything'

text: いいえ、まだ全てを白紙に戻す最後の手段が残っているはずよ / そのパスワードを教えなさい / 全プログラムのデリートは最高機密
translation: No, there should still be one last means to reset everything to zero. / Tell me that password. / Deleting all programs is top secret.
grammar: に戻す - 'to return to'; はずよ - expectation with feminine emphasis; 全プログラムの - genitive particle linking 'all programs' with deletion

text: 私の管轄外だ、公害の権限はない / だったら命令をもらいなさい、今すぐ
translation: It's outside my jurisdiction. I don't have that authority. / Then get authorization. Right now.
grammar: はない - negative form of existence; だったら - conditional 'if that's the case'; もらいなさい - command form 'receive/get'

text: 私だ、第二東京のマンダさんを頼む / そう、内務省長官だ
translation: It's me. Please connect me to Manda in Second Tokyo. / Yes, the Minister of the Interior.
grammar: を頼む - 'to request/ask for'; だ - assertive copula

text: ああ、その件はヤスギ君に任せである / 彼に聞いてくれ
translation: Ah, I've left that matter to Yasugi. / Ask him.
grammar: に任せである - 'have entrusted to'; てくれ - casual request form

text: そういう重要な決定事項は口頭ではね / 正式に書簡で回してもらえる
translation: Such important decisions can't be made orally. / Please send it formally in writing.
grammar: ではね - implies incompleteness/inadequacy; で回してもらえる - causative-passive requesting 'please have it sent'

text: では吉澤さんの許可を取ればよろしいんですね / ええ
translation: So I just need to get Yoshizawa-san's permission, right? / Yes.

vocabulary.meaning: to take, to get, to obtain

grammar: では marks a conclusion; ～ばよろしい is a formal conditional pattern meaning 'if you do X, that's fine'

text: ウイツ氏の承諾は得ておりますから / はい / はいでは / たらい回しか / 今から命令書が届く / 作業は正式なものだ / そんな間に合わないわ
translation: Since I've already obtained Mr. Witz's consent... / Yes. / Yes, well then... / Are they giving us the runaround? / The orders will arrive soon. / The work is official. / There's no way that will make it in time!

vocabulary.meaning: to be in time, to make it

grammar: ～ております is a humble/formal form of ～ている; そんな as an adverb means 'such' or emphasizes impossibility

text: 爆発してからじゃ何もかも遅いのよ
translation: Once it explodes, it'll be too late for everything!
grammar: ～してからじゃ means 'after X happens, then...'; のよ is feminine sentence-ending particle for emphasis

text: ジェットアーロンは厚着方面に向かい進行中 / 時間がないわ / これより先は私の独断で行動します / あしからず / あ、ヒュウガくん / 厚着にナッシー付けといたから
translation: Jet Alone is heading toward Atsugi and advancing. / We don't have time. / From here on, I'll act on my own authority. / I hope you'll forgive me. / Ah, Hyuga-kun. / I've sent the transport to Atsugi, so...
grammar: ～に向かい is 'heading toward'; これより先は means 'from here on'; ～ておく indicates preparation or advance action

text: シンジ君と初号機をF装備でこっちに起こして / そう、緊急事態 / 無駄よ、おやみなさい、桂木一
translation: Send Shinji-kun and Unit-01 here with F-Type equipment. / Yes, it's an emergency. / It's useless. Stop this, Katsuragi.

vocabulary.meaning: to wake up, to mobilize, to send

grammar: ～てこっちに起こして is 'send it here'; おやみなさい is the formal command form of やめる

text: 第一、どうやって止めるつもりなの? / 人間の手で直接
translation: First of all, how do you plan to stop it? / Directly, by human hand.

vocabulary.meaning: first of all, in the first place

grammar: どうやって means 'how, by what means'; ～つもり expresses intention/plan

text: 本気ですか / ええ / しかしライブはすでに汚染物質が充満している / 危険すぎる
translation: Are you serious? / Yes. / But the reactor is already filled with contaminants. / It's too dangerous.

vocabulary.meaning: to be filled with, to be saturated

grammar: すでに means 'already'; ～すぎる means 'too ~, excessively ~'

text: うまくいけばみんな助かります
translation: If it goes well, everyone will be saved.

vocabulary.meaning: to be saved, to be rescued

grammar: ～ば conditional means 'if'; うまくいく is an idiomatic expression for success

text: ここの式信号が切れるとハッチが手動で開けますから / バックパックから内部に侵入できます
translation: When the control signal is cut here, the hatch can be opened manually. / So we can enter the interior from the backpack.
grammar: ～と conditional indicates automatic consequence; ～から explains reason

text: 希望
translation: Hope.
grammar: Single word statement - the password being given

text: プログラム消去のパスワードだ
translation: It's the password for deleting the program.
grammar: の marks possessive/relationship; だ is the plain copula

text: ありがとう
translation: Thank you.
grammar: Standard expression of gratitude

text: 目標はJA / 5分以内に炉心誘拐の危険があります
translation: The target is JA. / There's a danger of reactor meltdown within 5 minutes.
grammar: ～以内に means 'within (time/space)'; があります indicates existence of danger

text: ですから目標をこれ以上人口密集時に近づけるわけにはいきません / ヒューガ君 / はい
translation: Therefore, we cannot let the target get any closer to populated areas. / Hyuga-kun. / Yes.
grammar: わけにはいかない means 'cannot possibly do'; これ以上 means 'any more than this'

text: エヴァを切り離した後は速やかに離脱 / 安全高度まで上昇して / 了解 / シジ君 / はい / 目標と並走し私を背後部に取り付けて / 以後は目標の移動を可能な限りせき止めてね
translation: After detaching the Eva, withdraw promptly. / Ascend to a safe altitude. / Understood. / Shinji-kun. / Yes. / Run alongside the target and attach me to the rear. / After that, stop the target's movement as much as possible, okay?
grammar: ～した後は means 'after doing ~'; 可能な限り means 'as much as possible, to the extent possible'

text: なるんですか / ミサトさんが / そうよ / そんな無 / 茶な / 無茶は承知よ / 他にベターな方法がないの / でも、危なすぎますよ / 大丈夫
translation: You're going to do it? / Misato-san is? / That's right. / That's so reck... / less... / I know it's reckless. / There's no better method. / But it's too dangerous! / It'll be fine.
grammar: ～んですか is explanatory question form; ～は承知 means 'I'm aware of ~'; ～すぎる means 'too ~'

text: エヴァなら万が一の直撃にも耐えられるわ / じゃなくて、ミサトさんが
translation: The Eva can withstand even a direct hit in the worst case. / That's not what I mean - it's you, Misato-san!
grammar: ～なら conditional means 'if it's ~'; ～にも means 'even to ~'; じゃなくて negates and redirects

text: ま、やれることやっとかないとね / 後味悪いでしょ
translation: Well, I have to do what I can, right? / It would leave a bad taste otherwise.

vocabulary.meaning: to do in advance (casual form of やっておく)

grammar: ～ておく (contracted to ～とく) indicates doing something in preparation; ～ないとね means 'have to ~, right?'

text: 目標を肉眼で確認
translation: Visual confirmation of target.
grammar: Technical/military reporting language - noun phrases without verbs

text: さあ、行くわよ
translation: Alright, here we go!
grammar: さあ is an interjection for readiness; わよ is feminine emphatic particle

text: エヴァー10日1日 / ドッキングアウト / 了解
translation: Eva Unit-01. / Docking out. / Roger.
grammar: Military/technical communication style

text: あと4分もないわ!このまま乗りつけて!
translation: We don't even have 4 minutes left! Just ride right up to it!

vocabulary.meaning: to ride up to, to charge in

grammar: ～もない emphasizes lack ('not even ~'); このまま means 'just as is, without changing'

text: 構わ / ないろ!やって!
translation: Don't worry about it! Just do it!
grammar: 構わない means 'don't worry about it'; imperative form for urgency

text: 美里さん!
translation: Misato-san!
grammar: Vocative - calling out someone's name

text: 気をつけて!
translation: Be careful!

vocabulary.meaning: to be careful, to watch out

grammar: ～て form as imperative for requests/warnings

text: この敵は、あなた
translation: This enemy is... you.
grammar: は marks the topic; dramatic pause before revelation

text: エラー?何よこれ
translation: Error? What is this?
grammar: よ adds emphasis/emotion; これ refers to 'this (situation)'

text: 間違いないプログラムが書いてあるんだ
translation: There's definitely a program written here.
grammar: ～てある indicates a state resulting from someone's action; んだ is explanatory ending

text: 動力炉臨海点まであと0.2 / 制御棒作動しません / こうなったら一か八かね
translation: 0.2 until the reactor reaches critical point. / Control rods won't operate. / At this point, it's do or die.

vocabulary.meaning: sink or swim, do or die

grammar: まであと means 'remaining until'; こうなったら means 'at this point, things being as they are'

text: 伊佐子さん逃げて! / いえーっ!このー!
translation: Ms. Isako, run away! / No! This...!
grammar: ～て (te-form imperative) used for urgent commands

text: ミサトさん!
translation: Misato!
grammar: Exclamatory call using name + さん

text: 臨界まであと0.1!ダメです!爆発します!
translation: Only 0.1 until critical! It's no good! It's going to explode!
grammar: まで (until/by) expressing proximity to critical point; します (polite future tense)

text: ダメか… / ミ / サトさん! / おー!
translation: Is it hopeless...? / Mi / sato! / Whoa!
grammar: か used for rhetorical/contemplative question

text: おー!
translation: Whoa!
grammar: Interjection expressing exertion or alarm

text: おー! / おー! / おー!
translation: Whoa! / Whoa! / Whoa!
grammar: Repeated interjections showing continuous exertion

text: おー! / おー!
translation: Whoa! / Whoa!
grammar: Continued interjections

text: おー!
translation: Whoa!
grammar: Final interjection

text: はー...
translation: Haah...
grammar: Extended vowel indicating exhaustion or relief

text: やったー! / 内圧ダウン! / 全て正常位置!
translation: We did it! / Internal pressure down! / Everything at normal position!
grammar: やった + ー (extended exclamation of success); technical status reports

text: やったー!やったー!や / ったー!やったー! / あのバカ…
translation: We did it! We did it! We / did it! We did it! / That idiot...
grammar: Repeated exclamations; あの + noun showing exasperated affection

text: ミサトさん!大丈夫ですか?ミサトさん! / ええ…まあ最低だけどね…
translation: Misato! Are you okay? Misato! / Yeah... well, I'm at my worst though...
grammar: ですか (polite question); だけどね (casual contrast with ね for emphasis)

text: よかった!無事なんですね!
translation: Thank goodness! You're safe!
grammar: なんですね (explanatory んです + confirmation ね)

text: よかった!本当によかった! / でもすごいや!僕見直しちゃいました! / 本当に奇跡は起きたんですね! / ええ…
translation: Thank goodness! I'm really glad! / But that's amazing! I've gained new respect for you! / A miracle really did happen! / Yeah...
grammar: ちゃいました (colloquial completed action); んですね (explanatory + confirmation)

text: 奇跡は用意されていたのよ…誰かにね…
translation: The miracle was prepared... by someone...
grammar: されていた (passive past continuous); のよ (explanatory female sentence ending); にね (particle + emphasis)

text: 初号機の回収は無事終了しました / 汚染の心配はありません
translation: Recovery of Unit-01 has been completed successfully / There is no concern about contamination
grammar: ました (polite past); はありません (polite negative existence)

text: 桂木一位の行動以外は全てシナリオ通りです / ご苦労
translation: Except for Captain Katsuragi's actions, everything went according to scenario / Good work
grammar: 以外は (except for + topic marker); 通り (suffix meaning 'according to')

text: おはよう
translation: Good morning
grammar: Casual morning greeting

text: さて、次は朝シャン朝シャン / プラとパンツはどこかいなと
translation: Well then, next is morning shower, morning shower / Now where are the bra and panties
grammar: かいな (Kansai dialect wondering particle); repeated words for emphasis

text: おはよう、いかりくん / はよう / 行ってきます / 行ってらっさい
translation: Good morning, Ikari-kun / Morning / I'm heading out / See you later
grammar: Standard departure/farewell exchange; らっさい (casual form of いらっしゃい)

text: やっぱかっこええな、みさとさんは / 僕もそう思ったけど / うちの中ちゃんみっともないよ / ほんとズボラだし / カッコ悪いし / つくづくだらしないし
translation: She's still really cool, Misato is / I thought so too, but / Inside the house she's pretty pathetic / Really sloppy / Uncool / Thoroughly careless
grammar: だし (listing reasons); Kansai dialect かっこええ (かっこいい)

text: 見たらこっちが恥ずかしいよ / 羨ましいな / それって
translation: Just looking at it makes me embarrassed / I'm jealous / That's...
grammar: たら (conditional); って (casual quotative particle)

text: どうして
translation: Why?
grammar: Simple question word

text: やっぱイカリってお子様なやつ / ほんまやな / どうして
translation: Ikari really is such a kid / That's true / Why?
grammar: って (quotative/emphasis); な (Kansai agreement particle); やな (Kansai だな)

text: 他人の俺たちには見せない / 本当の姿だろ
translation: It's her true self that she doesn't show to us outsiders
grammar: には (emphatic particle combination); だろ (casual だろう - assumption)

text: それって家族じゃないか
translation: Isn't that what family is?
grammar: って (topic marker); じゃないか (rhetorical question seeking agreement)

text: ドイツのビルヘルムスハーフェンを出港し / 一路日本 / へと向かうエヴァ2号機とそのパイロット / 突然の使徒襲来は起動した2号機に初の水中戦闘を強いる / 次回 明日来日
translation: Departing from Wilhelmshaven, Germany / Eva Unit-02 and its pilot / head straight for Japan / A sudden Angel attack forces the newly activated Unit-02 into its first underwater battle / Next episode: Asuka Strikes!
grammar: へと向かう (formal direction); を強いる (causative forcing); 次回 (next episode preview format)
